page.title: 05Lockington Street Fair.
page.content: In Lockington there is a{Street Fair} every year.The money raised is for the church.The choir each have jobs such as selling posies,balloons or helping with games.The stallholders dress up in{Victorian}clothes.At the beginning there is a fancy dress competition judged by the person who opens the fair.There is a wheelbarrow race through the ford and a slippery pole.There is a great variety of other stalls and cream teas are available in the village hall.Children from the school take part in dancing displays and they also design the cover for the programme.The main street is closed off to traffic and people come from miles around to enjoy the fun.
